content: 1. What is the main purpose of the "information-driven metrics" (ICM) in terms of marketing?

answers.text: a) the measurement of customer satisfaction.
b) the analysis of financial indicators to improve profitability.
c) the optimization of the product line.
d) the recording of customer information.

content: 2. Which of the following statements best describes the meaning of "information-driven metrics" (ICM) in the context of marketing?

answers.text: a) ICM are only relevant for small companies.
b) ICM are an important basis for strategic decisions in marketing.
c) ICM enable companies to better understand customer needs.
d) ICM are mainly geared towards measuring customer satisfaction.

content: 3. What is the main cause of the "information-driven metrics" (ICM) in Marketing?

answers.text: a) the dependence on traditional statistical analyzes.
b) the need to understand customer needs.
c) Avoiding costs for data analysis.
d) the fulfillment of regulatory requirements.

content: 4. How do "information-driven metrics" (ICM) influence decision-making in marketing?

answers.text: a) They only lead to a reduction in marketing costs.
b) They allow companies to make more informed decisions based on customer information.
c) They force companies to develop new marketing strategies.
d) They only lead to increased customer loyalty.

content: 5. What is meant by "information-driven metrics" (ICM) with regard to customer satisfaction?

answers.text: a) the measurement of customer reviews on social media.
b) The analysis of customer feedback and experiences to measure customer satisfaction.
c) the creation of marketing campaigns to improve customer satisfaction.
d) the development of new product variants based on customer feedback.

content: 6. Which of the following statements best describes the role of "information-driven metrics" (ICM) in strategic planning in marketing?

answers.text: a) ICM are only for the short -term optimization of marketing activities.
b) ICM enable companies to better understand customer needs and make strategic decisions.
c) ICM are irrelevant for the long -term marketing strategy.
d) ICM are exclusively for the recording of customer information.

content: 7. What is a potential problem that can occur in marketing when using "information-driven metrics" (ICM)?

answers.text: a) the risk that the data will be misinterpreted.
b) the difficulty of effectively analyzing the data.
c) the dependence on incomplete or inaccurate data.
d) the possibility that the data will be influenced too strongly by customers.

content: 8. How can "Information-Driven Metrics" (ICM) contribute to improving customer satisfaction?

answers.text: a) by increasing the price for customers.
b) by improving product quality and service.
c) by automating marketing activities.
d) by avoiding customer interactions.

content: 9. Which of the following statements is best to describe the role of "information-driven metrics" (ICM) in the context of the customer acquisition strategy?

answers.text: a) ICM are only relevant for customer loyalty.
b) ICM help companies win new customers.
c) ICM can help reduce the costs for customer acquisition.
d) ICM are irrelevant for the customer acquisition strategy.

content: 10. Which of the following statements is the best definition of "information-driven metrics" (ICM)?

answers.text: a) a measurement of customer satisfaction.
b) An analysis of financial indicators to improve profitability.
c) a comprehensive analysis of customer needs and behavior.
d) the creation of marketing campaigns to increase brand awareness.

content: 11. What is the main purpose of the "information-driven metrics" (ICM) in the context of customer relationship management (CRM)?

answers.text: a) the recording of customer data.
b) The analysis of customer data to improve customer relationship management.
c) the automation of sales processes.
d) the optimization of product development.

content: 12. What is the main motivation for the implementation of "information-driven metrics" (ICM) in a company?

answers.text: a) to exceed the competitors.
b) to improve customer satisfaction and increase profitability.
c) to motivate the employees.
d) to meet the regulatory requirements.
